column5: Hello All!  I just moved to Ottawa from Nova Scotia, and am seeking information about trout fishing, on the fly, in the Ottawa area.  I am a strictly catch & release fisherman, so I'm not gonna clear out your waters (not that I'm good enough if I weren't!).  I grew up on spooky little brook trout in cool running streams, and it's my favorite. I'm gonna play with other species now that I'm here, but I'd love some basic info on where to start my search for brookies.  I'd never ask for specific spots (not that anyone would give up a honey hole anyway), but some basic lay-of-the-land/water would be awesome.  I'll drive a reasonable distance, like to hike and love to earn my fish with a good trek. I'd rather not catch than overfish a pressured spot or fish next to the road.  Either way, I loved NovaScotiaFishing.com, and I hope I can learn from, and add to, ontariofishingcommnity.com.  (Now to sit back and wait for prime fishing spots to be emailed to me with GPS coordinates...)  john
Hi John. I'm sure some of the fellas will help you get started that are familiar with the area you speak of !!! Although I'm of no help  Cheers Matt
Welcome John !! You should hook up with Jacques(Trout Junkie) He lives accross the bridge on the Quebec side and is a Trout Magnet  Paul
Lots of options on Highway 17 west, especially in Algonquin Park!
Welcome sir!,you will love your stay here.Great people,and will help out when they can.Good luck.

Hi My Family is from the South Shore District 34 Cape Sable Island welcome cant help you with the trout though lots of guys on her will likely help you out be patient the trout guys scare me  Cheers Peter
Welcome Go explore The Jockos on 63 this May
